intro: Papaver rhoeas var. verum, commonly known as the true poppy, is a variant of the common poppy. It is a herbaceous annual plant that features striking red, papery flowers with a dark central area. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a taproot system. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
